$eref.description: If true, marks the whole project for JavaScript compilation. As a filename array, marks the given files for JavaScript compilation.
Provide a path to a file to write the .min.js output for the project.

Enable warnings on possible memory leaks due to unnecessary closure capture; see http://point.davidglasser.net/2013/06/27/surprising-javascript-memory-leak.html. "moveToTop" moves all non-capturing lambdas to top level automatically (experimental).
If true, WebSharper compiler errors will be treated as warnings.
Provide a path to a file to write the .js output for the project.

description: Schema for WebSharper wsconfig.json configuration file

_88downloadResources.description: If true, WebSharper downloads all remote js/css resources defined in the current project and all references.

_88minJsOutput.description: Provide a path to a file to write the .min.js output for the project.

_88javascript.description: If true, marks the whole project for JavaScript compilation. As a filename array, marks the given files for JavaScript compilation.

_88warnOnly.description: If true, WebSharper compiler errors will be treated as warnings.

_88sourceMap.description: If true, the compiler will include source maps and the required source files in a WebSharper assembly.

_88analyzeClosures.description: Enable warnings on possible memory leaks due to unnecessary closure capture; see http://point.davidglasser.net/2013/06/27/surprising-javascript-memory-leak.html. "moveToTop" moves all non-capturing lambdas to top level automatically (experimental).

_88jsOutput.description: Provide a path to a file to write the .js output for the project.

$eref.description: The WebSharper project type.
